page.title: 13MOTTRAM - Housing contd.
page.content: The earlier structures were simple, but roomy, terraced houses abutting on to the street, but as wealth increased in the late 19th Century, semi-detached and detached houses, with bay windows and gardens began to appear at the edge of Mottram and adjacent settlements. In the 20th Century larger pockets of houses were created on land adjacent to Mottram Old Hall and on either side of Stalybridge Road. These are locally known as the Old Hall estate, Roe Cross Green and Lane Ends estate. Shortage of building land and Green belt status of the open spaces now only allows for ilnfill of houses or conversion of present farm structures.
